item.title: 10 Feb (Saturday) 1-4pm Bi Women’s Brunch at Sarah’s in JP
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
Please bring a potluck item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi and bi-friendly women in the area! Please note that this brunch starts at 1pm (later than usual). Accessibility note: the brunch is in a second-floor apartment with no elevator. The building is a short distance from the T. Please […]

The post 10 Feb (Saturday) 1-4pm Bi Women’s Brunch at Sarah’s in JP appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
Please bring a potluck item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi and bi-friendly women in the area! Please note that this brunch starts at 1pm (later than usual).

Accessibility note: the brunch is in a second-floor apartment with no elevator. The building is a short distance from the T.

Please RSVP to: rowleyfundraiser@gmail.com

The post 10 Feb (Saturday) 1-4pm Bi Women’s Brunch at Sarah’s in JP appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: Dec 2 – Stuff ‘n’ Stuff Brunch & Mailing at Robyn’s in Jamaica Plain
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
Bring a potluck brunch item to share and help with the mailing of BWQ! This is a great way to meet other bi and bi-friendly women in the area! Cats in home. Info/RSVP: robyn@robynochs.com

item.title: Jan 21 – Bi Women’s Brunch at Charlotte’s in Dorchester
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
Noon-3pm. Please bring a potluck item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi and bi-friendly women in the area! This is a pet free home near JFK/UMass T station. There are ~10 steps leading up to the apartment. RSVP: avon.alger@gmail.com

The post Jan 21 – Bi Women’s Brunch at Charlotte’s in Dorchester appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
Noon-3pm. Please bring a potluck item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi and bi-friendly women in the area! This is a pet free home near JFK/UMass T station. There are ~10 steps leading up to the apartment.

RSVP: avon.alger@gmail.com

item.title: Jan 25 – Bi+-Trans* Support Group
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
The BRC’s bisexual+/transgender* support group is a peer-facilitated, safe space in Jamaica Plain where individuals can discuss many different topics related to gender and sexuality. Info/RSVP: See the Bi Community Activities page on Meetup.com

The post Jan 25 – Bi+-Trans* Support Group appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: Sept. 22. 7-10pm Celebrate Bisexuality Day Celebration
item.dc:creator: birobyn
item.description:
Wear your bi pride colors and join us for snacks, drinks, a raffle, and meeting new awesome members of your local bi+ community! We will also have some sweet merchandise for sale. At the Lir Pub, 903 Boylston St, Boston, Massachusetts 02115 You can RSVP here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1946441712305436

The post Sept. 22. 7-10pm Celebrate Bisexuality Day Celebration appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
Wear your bi pride colors and join us for snacks, drinks, a raffle, and meeting new awesome members of your local bi+ community! We will also have some sweet merchandise for sale.

At the Lir Pub, 903 Boylston St, Boston, Massachusetts 02115

You can RSVP here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1946441712305436

item.title: Oct. 15, 12-3: Women’s Potluck Brunch
item.dc:creator: birobyn
item.description:
October 15 (Sunday) 12-3pm, Women’s Potluck Brunch at Maura & Linda’s in Arlington. We look forward to seeing new faces as well as hanging out with favorites in the bi+ and bi+- friendly community of Boston. Bring a friend, too! RSVP: maurahalbert@hotmail.com.

The post Oct. 15, 12-3: Women’s Potluck Brunch appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
October 15 (Sunday) 12-3pm, Women’s Potluck Brunch at Maura & Linda’s in Arlington. We look forward to seeing new faces as well as hanging out with favorites in the bi+ and bi+- friendly community of Boston. Bring a friend, too! RSVP: maurahalbert@hotmail.com.

The post Oct. 15, 12-3: Women’s Potluck Brunch appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: Sept. 24 12-3: BBWN Book Swap!
item.dc:creator: birobyn
item.description:
Join us for the highly-anticipated annual BBWN Book Swap at Steph’s in Arlington. Co-hosted with Ellyn, the book swap is a wonderful opportunity to share good reads and take home future treats. Open to all genres, good condition only. Audiobooks are included.  No textbooks. Plus, bring a dish and drinks to share for the monthly […]

The post Sept. 24 12-3: BBWN Book Swap! appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
Join us for the highly-anticipated annual BBWN Book Swap at Steph’s in Arlington. Co-hosted with Ellyn, the book swap is a wonderful opportunity to share good reads and take home future treats. Open to all genres, good condition only. Audiobooks are included.  No textbooks. Plus, bring a dish and drinks to share for the monthly delicious potluck. Enjoy the safe space of bi+ women’s community. Please RSVP to Steph at smiserlis@gmail.com.

The post Sept. 24 12-3: BBWN Book Swap! appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: July 9 (Sunday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Kara’s in Milford, NH
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
12-3pm, Women’s Potluck Brunch. This one’s at Kara’s in Milford, NH. It may seem far away, but it is worth it. Great for northern Mass and NH folks! Lots of parking. Bring a potluck brunch item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi+ and bi+-friendly women in the area! Info/RSVP: kara.ammon@gmail.com. Mention […]

The post July 9 (Sunday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Kara’s in Milford, NH appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
12-3pm, Women’s Potluck Brunch. This one’s at Kara’s in Milford, NH. It may seem far away, but it is worth it. Great for northern Mass and NH folks! Lots of parking. Bring a potluck brunch item to share. This is a great way to meet other bi+ and bi+-friendly women in the area! Info/RSVP: kara.ammon@gmail.com. Mention in your RSVP if you need a ride share. We can’t promise rides, but can try to help.

The post July 9 (Sunday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Kara’s in Milford, NH appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: August 19 (Saturday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Mitsy & Liana’s in Jamaica Plain
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Alger
item.description:
BRUNCH TIME CHANGED TO 9:30. Please join us at our little JP oasis, right off of Centre St.! We have a lovely backyard with a family-style table, so please feel free to bring picnic/BBQ items to share! We look forward to seeing new faces as well as hanging out with favorites in the bi+ and […]

The post August 19 (Saturday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Mitsy & Liana’s in Jamaica Plain appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
item.content:encoded:
BRUNCH TIME CHANGED TO 9:30. Please join us at our little JP oasis, right off of Centre St.! We have a lovely backyard with a family-style table, so please feel free to bring picnic/BBQ items to share! We look forward to seeing new faces as well as hanging out with favorites in the bi+ and bi+-friendly community of Boston. Bring a friend, too! RSVP: mitsyblue4@yahoo.com.

Please read the following message from Mitsy regarding the time change: 

Good morning everyone,
Across the country, hearts are heavy given the recent attacks in Charlottesville.  I for one had difficulty processing the anachronistic images, a sobering reminder that this country is not in a good place (and arguably never was, in spite of the progress made on many fronts). People are increasingly turning to words and actions of hate to get the message across that many of us are not welcome.
A rally is being organized this coming Saturday (August 19th) by the BLM Network/BLM Cambridge Resistance & Response, spurred by an unidentified right-wing group that had invited speakers to defend the right to “free speech”–speech that invariably incites violence and hatred.  The Black Lives Matter Network will be gathering at 10am at the Reggie Lewis Track and Field Center in Roxbury, then marching to the Boston Common.  (You can find more info here.)  In order to allow folks the opportunity to participate in the rally, I have decided to roll back the start time of the bi-brunch to 9:30am (to a bi-breakfast, if you will), and folks are welcome to come together to eat, discuss, make signs, and then we can head over to the Boston Common as a crew.  I will purchase a few poster board signs and and markers, and if people wanted to bring supplies, it would be more than welcome.    
 
This is our moment to act, to use our voices, to be seen and heard.  These are our opportunities to come together as a city bear witness to unity in our humanity, no matter our race, our ethnicity, our gender identity, our sexuality, our socio-economic background.  I hope you will join me–let me know if you are able to attend and I will send along my address in JP.  
 
In solidarity, 
 
Mitsy

The post August 19 (Saturday) – Women’s Potluck Brunch at Mitsy & Liana’s in Jamaica Plain appeared first on biwomenboston.org.

item.title: Sept. 28-Oct. 1: BECAUSE Conference
item.dc:creator: birobyn
item.description:
People from across the US will converge in Minneapolis on September 28-October 1st for BECAUSE 2017 (Bi+ EmpowermentConference: A Uniting, Supportive Experience)

The post Sept. 28-Oct. 1: BECAUSE Conference appeared first on biwomenboston.org.
